body:
Increase max locked memory take effect in kvm32 system with 16GB ram(repeatable), but do not works in an old ASUS UL30A notebook with 8G ram(always fail, when max locked memory set to 64K, 256K, 8M, 64M). I will dig more before report back. ulimit -a(kvm32 and notebook) 
socket buffer size       (bytes, -b) unlimited
core file size          (blocks, -c) unlimited
data seg size           (kbytes, -d) 524288
file size               (blocks, -f) unlimited
max locked memory       (kbytes, -l) 64
max memory size         (kbytes, -m) unlimited
open files                      (-n) 58041
pipe size            (512 bytes, -p) 1
stack size              (kbytes, -s) 65536
cpu time               (seconds, -t) unlimited
max user processes              (-u) 5547
virtual memory          (kbytes, -v) unlimited
swap size               (kbytes, -w) unlimited
kvm32 cpu: 
OS		: 'FreeBSD'
hw.model	: 'Common 32-bit KVM processor'
hw.machine	: 'i386'
hw.machine_arch : 'i386'
cpu details	:
CPU: Common 32-bit KVM processor (2100.05-MHz 686-class CPU)
  Origin="GenuineIntel"  Id=0xf61  Family=0xf  Model=0x6  Stepping=1
  Features=0x1783fbff
  Features2=0x80200001
-msse3 -mfpmath=sse
